Software Engineering Project - Course Guide

Project selection and teams

This page explains how to choose a project, how teams are formed, and what is expected once allocations are made.

On this page

  • Key information
  • How project selection works
  • Submit your team and choices

Key information

  • Form a team of 3 (choose a clear team name).
  • Pick 5 project preferences from the catalog (duplicates across teams are allowed).
  • Submit preferences with a short motivation via the selection form (deadline: 24 Oct, 23:59).
  • Allocations announced 27 Oct on Announcements.
  • ⚠️ No reallocation after publication — choose wisely.

See also: Planning, Coaching, Deliverables & deadlines, and the project catalog: Projects.

How project selection works

Step 1 – Form a team

  • Teams consist of 3 students; exceptions only with explicit coach approval.
  • Teams are self-formed; coach will only assign students who cannot find a team (notify coach before the submission deadline).
  • Choose a team name and use it consistently in all communication.
  • Aim for complementary skills and interests.

Step 2 – Explore the catalog

  • Read the short description and learning outcomes for each project.
  • Discuss with your team which topics fit your interests and the skills you want to grow.

Step 3 – Submit your preferences

  • One submission per team.

  • Provide:

    • Team name + members (full name + student email)
    • Your top 5 ranked project choices (1 = highest priority)
    • A short motivation (2–4 sentences or bullet points) for each choice: what you want to learn and why this project fits your goals

  • Use the forms at the bottom of this page: Team submission form and Project preferences form.

Step 4 – Allocation

  • Coach assigns projects based on: team preferences, balance across topics, motivation, and capacity.
  • Duplicates are possible: more than one team may work on the same project.
  • If multiple teams want the same project, ties are resolved fairly.

Step 5 – Confirmation

  • Allocations are published on 27 Oct on Announcements.
  • ⚠️ Allocations are final — no changes after publication.

Submit your team and choices

  • Team submission: Team submission form — coming soon Prepare the following before the form opens:

    • Team name (use consistently in all communication)
    • 3 members: full name + student email

  • Project preferences: Project preferences form — coming soon Prepare the following:

    • Your team name (exactly as submitted above)

    • Your top 5 project choices (ranked)

    • A short motivation (2–4 sentences or bullet points) for each choice:

      • What your team wants to learn
      • Why the topic fits your goals

⚠️ Reminder: No reallocation after publication — choose carefully.

Note: Links will also appear on Announcements when the forms go live.
